intro: Pandaca mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius pandaca, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with woody stems and opposite leaves. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and is protected in conservation efforts on the island.
